issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
compile-mapred-test target is failing once again.
Details: https://builds.apache.org/view/G-L/view/Hadoop/job/Hadoop-Mapreduce-0.23-Build/83/consoleFull

BUILD FAILED
/home/jenkins/jenkins-slave/workspace/Hadoop-Mapreduce-0.23-Build/trunk/hadoop-mapreduce-project/build.xml:526: The following error occurred while executing this line:
/home/jenkins/jenkins-slave/workspace/Hadoop-Mapreduce-0.23-Build/trunk/hadoop-mapreduce-project/build.xml:603: Compile failed; see the compiler error output for details.
{code}

0.23 branch build breaking as the test fixes for MAPREDUCE-3217 and MAPREDUCE-3221 were using hdfs protocol related changes that have not merged into 0.23. 

This patch is only for branch-0.23. Effectively reverts some of the changes done for fixing the tests. 

Will need to revert/fix these tests again if the hdfs protocol related changes are merged to 0.23.
The other option to fix the build would be to just revert the changes in the jiras mentioned in the previous comment.

I have downloaded this patch which now allows me to run the following command successfully

ant veryclean all-jars -Dresolvers=internal

+1 non-binding

Merging MAPREDUCE-3217 and MAPREDUCE-3221 into 0.23 was an oversight.

Verified the patch. Looks good to me too. +1.
I just committed this to branch-0.23. Thanks Hitesh!

Integrated in Hadoop-Hdfs-0.23-Commit #157 (See [https://builds.apache.org/job/Hadoop-Hdfs-0.23-Commit/157/])
    MAPREDUCE-3368. Fixed test compilation. Contributed by Hitesh Shah.
